posts.cooked:
I searched but couldn’t find any existing feature request for this.

Now that Desktop has screen-sharing, it would be nice to have the ability to generate an invite link that we could send to one person to invite them to a call.

The use case is, for example, an online lesson, where I don’t necessarily want to have the student’s phone number in my contacts. Sending them a link via email would make it easy for them to join the lesson.

This may become easier when usernames come along - especially if it could be done with usernames alone, without sharing phone numbes.

I think this is a great idea, although your use-case would probably not be satisfied with the 8-People limit that we currently have.

OffTopic: Do you know jitsi or bigbluebutton? Those are great alternatives for your scenario

MrShadowfly:

8-People limit

I’m thinking private one-to-one tutoring or very small private groups so this limit would not be an issue at all.

MrShadowfly:

Do you know jitsi or bigbluebutton?

Heard of jitsi, not heard of the other one.
We currently use Teams, Skype or Nextcloud Talk, depending on availability (Teams is preferred esp. due to office apps collaborative integration).

posts.cooked:
github.com/signalapp/libsignal

zkgroup: Add a "Create Call Link" credential

committed 11:53PM - 25 Apr 23 UTC
jrose-signal
+2088 -75

This will allow a user to request to create a call link from the chat server wi…thout revealing anything about the room, and then later actually create it by giving the room ID to the calling server without identifying themself. This involves a new, stripped-down GenericServer{Secret,Public}Params, which currently only contains a generic "zkcredential" key. Apart from the calling server not needing to handle all the credentials that the group storage server supports, the structure of zkcredential means it is safe to use the same key for multiple kinds of credentials. Similarly, CallLink{Secret,Public}Params plays the same role as Group{Secret,Public}Params for encrypting user IDs when talking to the calling server. Following from that, the APIs for CreateCallLinkCredentials are located on the individual types (RequestContext, Request, Response, Credential, Presentation) rather than all being on the Server*Params types; adding a new credential type won't change the API of the Server*Params types at all. The main Server*Params may make use of zkcredential in the future as well, but for now it's only for new Signal servers that want to use zero-knowledge credentials.

This will allow a user to request to create a call link from the chat server without revealing anything about the room, and then later actually create it by giving the room ID to the calling server without identifying themself.

This involves a new, stripped-down GenericServer{Secret,Public}Params, which currently only contains a generic “zkcredential” key. Apart from the calling server not needing to handle all the credentials that the group storage server supports, the structure of zkcredential means it is safe to use the same key for multiple kinds of credentials. Similarly, CallLink{Secret,Public}Params plays the same role as Group{Secret,Public}Params for encrypting user IDs when talking to the calling server.

Following from that, the APIs for CreateCallLinkCredentials are located on the individual types (RequestContext, Request, Response, Credential, Presentation) rather than all being on the ServerParams types; adding a new credential type won’t change the API of the ServerParams types at all.

The main Server*Params may make use of zkcredential in the future as well, but for now it’s only for new Signal servers that want to use zero-knowledge credentials

posts.cooked:
This is all very interesting!
My main question now is: will this call link system allow someone to join a Signal call on a browser without having Signal installed?

Or, alternatively, will it be made in such a clever way so as if there is no Signal app installed on the recipient’s device, it directs them to the appropriate app store or web link (in case of desktops)?

DonDino:

will this call link system allow someone to join a Signal call on a browser without having Signal installed?

No, the purpose is to allow inviting people to join a call with a link, just like you can with group chats.

DonDino:

will it be made in such a clever way so as if there is no Signal app installed on the recipient’s device, it directs them to the appropriate app store or web link (in case of desktops)?

I would expect it to do so since that is how group links already behave. I think sticker pack links might do that as well.

https://community.signalusers.org/t/feedback-on-new-topic-titled-simplify-group-calling/60155?u=user-signal

For how long a similar feature is requested but not satisfied. Why to complicate user interface with excessive clicks?..
Please consider my suggestion.

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked: @user-signal The call link feature is under active development

@ moderators @salt505

Great that Signal team react on features request. Could you please explain why you chosen link for group call? Anyway when user will create a group call link, he/she must send it to each participant of call. So how such implementation solves problem of excessive clicks/movements?!.. Why you cannot choose as simple as possible user interface when during one-to-one call the user will be able to click “add button” and join additional participant from book phone?..
Call link is simply senseless because user need to send it somewhere, so in such case it is possible just create group chat like it is now.

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
Please don’t @ the moderators group, or any other group, unless absolutely necessary, thank you :)

As a volunteer moderator, I do not work for Signal.

user-signal:

Why you cannot choose as simple as possible user interface when during one-to-one call the user will be able to click “add button” and join additional participant from book phone?..

You’re looking for this feature request here:
Add users to calls without creating a group

user-signal:

Call link is simply senseless because user need to send it somewhere

Call links will (hopefully) be helpful for creating calls in which someone can join even if they’re not in your contacts.

link_counts.title: Add users to calls without creating a group

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
Now in beta for Desktop!

Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.30 release

Introducing Call Links: The missing link for calendar invites and impromptu gatherings.

  • Now you can quickly create an easy link that anyone on Signal can use to join a group call without having to join a Signal group chat first.
  • Call links are reusable and ideal for recurring phone dates with your best friends or weekly check-ins with your coworkers.
  • You can manage your call links, control approval settings, and copy links from the calls tab for quick sharing.

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.30 release

posts.name: Jeremy
posts.cooked: And in beta for android!

posts.name: Jeffrey
posts.cooked:
Some screenshot in last Android 7.21 Beta.

Screenshots

IMG_20241017_1503231080×704 83.1 KB

IMG_20241017_1504161080×2400 101 KB

IMG_20241017_1505111080×1852 84.9 KB

And I only now realise this was my very own feature request

This is great! Not quite as I envisaged it, but I understand why it can’t be web-based. And now with usernames and PNP, it’s much easier to get people on board if you reassure them phone numbers won’t be shared (as you’ll have to get people not on Signal to register with Signal first, before you can e.g. send them lesson links).

MrShadowfly:

Do you know jitsi

I have now been using Jitsi for about a year, and it works flawlessly, I believe it’s currently the best thing for ephemeral calls/meetings but where you can also have a permanent link to re-use for e.g. series of lessons.

posts.cooked:
I’m very happy with the new Call Link feature.

It’d be really good if you could customize your display name and avatar for each Call or (maybe) being anonymous.
For example if you have a funny avatar for friends and your full name, you don’t want to expose these in a public call with hunders of unknown people.
I think we can mark this as complete now? In production on desktop and Android and at the very least in beta on iOS.
